question: 開ける
sourceAnswer: to{}{open-(a-door,-etc.)/unwrap-(e.g.-parcel,-package)/unlock} | to{}open-(for-business,-etc.) | to{}{empty/remove/make-space/make-room} | to{}{move-out/clear-out} | to{}{be-away-from-(e.g.-one's-house)/leave-(temporarily)} | to:{dawn/grow-light} | to:end-(of-a-period,-season) | to:begin-(of-the-New-Year) | to:{leave-(one's-schedule)-open/make-time-(for)} | to:{make-(a-hole)/open-up-(a-hole)}
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>open</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to open something</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You go <vocabulary>to open</vocabulary> the door. When you do, a huge scream comes out: "<reading>AAAHHH</reading>!" (<ja>あ</ja>). Imagine giant <ja>あ</ja> characters flying out of the door you opened as well.
